Package com.msasc.lib.ml.graph

Class Network

java.lang.Object
com.msasc.lib.ml.graph.Network
public class Network extends Object
A network or computational graph, made of wired cells of nodes that interface through input and output edges. Data is forward pushed to the input edges and a call to forward() triggers the calculation processes to finally push the output to the output edges. Inversely, deltas or errors are backward pushed to the output edges and a call to backward() triggers the calculation processes to adjust internal parameters.
Author:
Miquel Sas

    • add

      public void add(Cell... cells)
      Add a series of cells.
      Parameters:

    • backward

      public void backward(List<double[]> outputDeltasList)
      Launch the backward pass.
      Parameters:
      outputDeltasList - List of arrays of output deltas, in the same order as the list of output edges.

    • forward

      public void forward(List<double[]> inputValuesList)
      Launch the forward pass.
      Parameters:
      inputValuesList - List of arrays of input values, in the same order as the list of input edges.

      Returns:

    • getOutputValues

      public List<double[]> getOutputValues()
      Returns the list of output values of the network, normally required after a forward() call.
      Returns:
      The list of output values.

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initialize the network. This method must be called after adding all the cells and wires, and before the call to the first forward() or backward().

      Builds the lists of input and output edges, and the list of layers in a forward order.

    • unfold

      public void unfold()
      Unfold edges.
